3. A near-exhaustive list of regional accounts would include Guangzhou (Hai Feng
1971; Yan 2015; 2018); Inner Mongolia (Yang Haiying 2014; Wu Di 2010);
Jiangsu (Dong and Walder 2010; 2011a; 2011b; 2012a; 2018); Ningxia (Wu and
Zhao 2007); Shaanxi (Tanigawa 2007; 2018); Shanghai (Li Xun 2015; Perry and
Li 1997); Wuhan (Wang 1995); and Zhejiang (Forster 1990).
4.For example,MacFarquhar and Schoenhals (2006) tie their national narrative
to an intensive analysis of politics in Beijing. One exception is Bu Weihua
(2008), who provides a long series of capsule summaries of province-level
developments.

coherent overall interpretation, the“radical-conservative hypothesis,”which was
a major interpretivebreakthrough at the time.
